pages.title: About
pages.intro:
Hi! I'm Bren, and I'm a Senior Front End Developer who is passionate about building robust, accessible software while empowering my teams to become strongly capable, compassionate developers.

I'm a software engineer. I'm a father. I'm a musician. I'm a photographer.

sections.title: What do I care most about?

cards.title: People.
cards.content: As a developer, people are the heart of everything I do. I don't build software for the sake of building software. I build software to help people. All people. It's my duty as a developer to make sure that my deliverables are accessible to everyone through empathy and a deep understanding of WCAG standards. It's also my duty to build and enable capable, diverse and inclusive teams that can deliver robust, thoughtfully designed and rigoursouly tested projects.

sections.title: What are my core skills?
sections.intro:
First and foremost, I am a skilled front-end practioner with over 15 years experience working in web development, and over 25 years working in IT. Among my skills I pride myself on:

  • Front-end development
  • Testing
  • Accessibility
  • Mentoring and leading teams of developers

cards.title: Front-end development
cards.content:
My happy place is working on the front end. This is the point I feel I can add the most value to the end user and realise the design vision of my team. I enjoy working with:

  • JavaScript - particularly React
  • Accessible HTML
  • CSS to wizardy levels

cards.title: Testing
cards.content:
I enjoy breaking my code down into tiny, easy to test pieces which ensures a more robust end product. I'm familiar with and proficient in:

  • Jest for functional unit testing
  • React Testing Library for component testing
  • Playwright for end-to-end and UI testing
  • Manual accessibility testing.

cards.title: Accessibility
cards.content: As a neuro-diverse person in tech, I'm incredibly passionate about accessibiliity and this is at the front of my mind for all interfaces I work on. I'm constantly thinking about who might be interacting with my deployed code and how any visual, auditory or physical processing impairments might affect their application interactions.

cards.title: Mentoring and leading
cards.content:
I might have mentioned it, but I love leading and growing people. I have a great variety of mentoring and teaching experience including:

  • Mentoring junior and intermediate developers across a range of organisations
  • Creating a co-leading front-end education sessions at BNZ
  • Teaching JS & React development to new developers at Dev Academy Aoteroa
  • Facilitating learning for children in tech through Code Club Aoteroa
  • 10 years leading, mentoring and teaching through the New Zealand Cadet Forces.

sections.title: BNZ
sections.content: Senior Front End Developer - Nov 2021 to July 2024

sections.title: Dev Academy Aoteroa (formerly Enspiral Dev Academy)
